subject: Productivity
title: Status Quo Bias
description: A short lesson to help you apply Status Quo Bias.

hook.text: Opt-out organ donation countries have 90% donor rates. Opt-in countries get 15%. Same people, different default.

buildup.text: Status quo bias means people prefer the current state even when change would clearly benefit them.

discovery.text: In prioritization, this means yesterday's priorities persist even when circumstances have changed.

twist.text: Changing priorities feels risky. Keeping them feels safe. But keeping outdated priorities is the riskier choice.

climax.text: Regular priority reviews with a fresh-start mentality combat status quo bias. Reprioritize from zero periodically.

punchline.text: The safest-feeling option is often the most dangerous.

quiz.question: What is status quo bias?
options: Preferring the current state even when change would be better
